intro: Cruciata glabra subsp. alpina, commonly known as the alpine cruciata, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its subspecies status reflects adaptations to high-altitude conditions, including cold tolerance and compact growth. The species is of interest to botanists and gardeners for its ornamental value and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
